entry.title: The Finance Act 2002, Schedule 26 (Parts 2 and 9) (Amendment No. 3) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order further amends Parts 2 and 9 of Schedule 26 to the Finance Act 2002, which deals with the taxation of derivative contracts.

entry.title: The Tuberculosis (England) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order, which applies in England only, revokes and re-enacts the Tuberculosis (England and Wales) Order 1984 with alterations. It also introduces an obligation to test certain animals before movement.

entry.title: The Loan Relationships and Derivative Contracts (Exchange Gains and Losses using Fair Value Accounting) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the calculations for exchange gain and loss in loan relationships and derivative contracts where the assets and liabilities involved are accounted for using fair value accounting.

entry.title: The Magistrates' Courts (Miscellaneous Amendments) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Rules make amendments to two sets of rules, which apply in proceedings in magistrates' courts, in consequence of the Civil Partnership Act 2004 (c. 33). The Civil Partnership Act 2004 introduces a statutory civil registration procedure to allow same-sex couples to make a formal, legal commitment to each other by entering into a civil partnership. The Rules amend the Magistrates' Courts (Domestic Proceedings) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1996 to prescribe the procedures for proceedings under Schedule 16 to the 2004 Act. They also make minor consequential amendments to forms prescribed in the Magistrates' Courts (Children (Northern Ireland) Order 1995) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1996.

entry.title: The Fossil Fuel Levy (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Fossil Fuel Levy Regulations 1996 (“the Principal Regulations”) (S.I. 1996/293). They come into force on 1st April 2006. Any reference in this note to a numbered regulation is a reference to the regulation bearing that number in the Principal Regulations. Regulations 2 to 8, 11, 12, 20, 21, 23, 28, 32 and 36 are substituted. Regulations 15, 19 and 27 are omitted.

entry.title: Rates (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend paragraph 5 of Schedule 2 to the Rates Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000 to allow for the amount granted by way of hardship relief in respect of specified hereditaments or former specified hereditaments in any district council area to be taken into account when ascertaining the loss on collection of non-domestic rates for the council of that district for any year.

entry.title: The Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into force of certain provisions of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005 on 1 January 2006. The provisions are listed in article 2 of the Order. The provisions all relate to the creation of a new Commission for Architecture and the Built Environment and the dissolution of the old Commission.

entry.title: Non-Domestic Rating (Hardship Relief) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for hardship relief in respect of certain hereditaments from 31st December 2005.

entry.title: The Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Part VIII of Schedule 1 to the Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004 (“the 2004 Regulations”). The 2004 Regulations implement Council Directive 97/78/EC laying down the principles governing the organisation of veterinary checks on products entering the Community from third countries (O.J. No. L24, 30.1.98, p. 9).

entry.title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Regulatory Own Funds) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972 (c. 68) and implement Article 17 of the European Union Directive 2003/41/EC on the Activities and Supervision of Institutions for Occupational Retirement Provision (OJ No. L 235, 23.9.03, p.10) (“the Directive”).

entry.title: The Individual Ascertainment of Value (England) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order provides for the ascertainment of market value of bovine animals which the Secretary of State causes to be slaughtered under section 32 of the Animal Health Act 1981 in its application to brucellosis, tuberculosis or enzootic bovine leukosis. It should be read with the Cattle Compensation Order 2005, S.I. 2005/3433.

entry.title: The Adults with Incapacity (Countersignatories of Applications for Authority to Intromit) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Adults with Incapacity (Countersignatories of Applications for Authority to Intromit) (Scotland) Regulations 2001 to include further classes of persons who may countersign an application made under section 26 of the Adults with Incapacity (Scotland) Act 2000.

entry.title: The Bus Lane Contraventions (Approved Local Authorities) (England) (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Bus Lane Contraventions (Approved Local Authorities) (England) Order 2005 by adding Elmbridge Borough Council to the list of local authorities which are “approved local authorities” for the purposes of section 144 of the Transport Act 2000 (civil enforcement of bus lane contraventions).

entry.title: The Adults with Incapacity (Supervision of Welfare Guardians etc. by Local Authorities) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Adults with Incapacity (Supervision of Welfare Guardians etc. by Local Authorities) (Scotland) Regulations 2002 in respect of welfare guardians whose appointment is for at least a year. The intervals within which a local authority must arrange for visits, other than the initial visit, to an incapable adult and that adult’s welfare guardian are extended from three to six months. Local authorities must continue to arrange to visit the welfare guardian, as well as the incapable adult, within three months of the guardian’s appointment. The requirements on local authorities to arrange visits to welfare guardians do not apply where the Chief Social Work Officer is the welfare guardian.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Financial Promotion) (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Financial Promotion) Order 2005 (S.I. 2005/1529) (the “Financial Promotion Order”). Article 2 of this Order amends the Financial Promotion Order as follows. Paragraph (2) amends article 2(1) so that civil partners are treated in the same way as spouses for the purposes of the definition of “close relative”. Paragraph (3) amends article 20(5)(c) so that a person’s civil partner is treated as a member of his family for the purposes of article 20 (communications by journalists). Paragraph (4) amends article 60(2)(a)(ii) so that civil partners and surviving civil partners of employees or former employees are treated in the same way as spouses, widows and widowers in relation to employee share schemes.

entry.title: Foyle Area and Carlingford Area (Licensing of Fishing Engines) (Amendment) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Foyle Area and Carlingford Area (Licensing of Fishing Engines) Regulations 2001 by prescribing new licence fees for 2006. The 2006 fees and the increases from 2005 are as follows:

entry.title: The Local Authority (Adoption) (Miscellaneous Provisions) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for when people wish to adopt a child who is not placed for adoption with them by an adoption agency, and enable local authorities to charge for services provided in connection with adoptions with a foreign element and to use people who are not their employees in the exercise of their functions.

entry.title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Internal Controls) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Pensions Act 2004 (c. 35) (“the Act”) by adding section 249A (requirement for internal controls). Section 249A implements the requirement in Article 14(1) of the European Union Directive on the Activities and Supervision of Institutions for Occupational Retirement Provision (Directive 2003/41/EC) (“the Directive”) that the trustees or managers of an occupational pension scheme must have adequate internal control mechanisms.

entry.title: The Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Part VIII of Schedule 1 to the Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Wales) Regulations 2005 (SI 2005/666) (“the 2005 Regulations”). The 2005 Regulations implement Council Directive 97/78/EC laying down the principles governing the organisation of veterinary checks on products entering the Community from third countries (OJ No. L24, 30.1.98, p.9).

entry.title: The Designation of Schools Having a Religious Character (Independent Schools) (England) (No. 3) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order designates the independent schools named as having a religious character.
